Despite or perhaps because of very high alcohol content, the wine's richness and intensity make it a standout choice for those who appreciate bold flavors and robust pairings.

The medium-weight mouth is structured and bold, with chewy tannins and heady flavors of plum and berry preserves, roasted coffee and sweet licorice. The finish is long and dry, and although this would certainly benefit from 5–10 years of cellaring time, it's approachable now with decanting.
